metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6819 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Under certain conditions, when running the nsDocShell destructor, a race condition can cause a use-after-free. We are aware of targeted attacks in the wild abusing this flaw. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.7.0, Firefox < 74.0.1, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
